name: Processeur et validateur de factures avec OCR, IA et Google Sheets
description:
### 📝 Dites adieu à la vérification manuelle des factures ! 
**Ce flux de travail intelligent automatise** l'ensemble de votre pipeline de traitement des factures en utilisant **IA**, **OCR** et **Google Sheets**.

---

### ⚙️ **Ce que fait ce flux de travail :**

📥 **1. Lit un PDF de facture**
— Sélectionnez un PDF de facture local depuis votre machine.

🔍 **2. Extrait le texte brut à l'aide de l'OCR**
— Convertit les PDF numérisés ou numériques en texte lisible.

🧠 **3. L'agent IA traite le texte**
— Transforme le texte brut désordonné en JSON propre à l'aide de la compréhension du langage naturel.

🧱 **4. Structure et affine le JSON**
— Convertit la sortie de l'IA en un format structuré et utilisable.

🔄 **5. Sépare les données par article**
— Extrait les lignes de facture individuelles avec tous les détails.

🆔 **6. Génère des clés uniques**
— Crée un identifiant unique pour chaque article pour le suivi.

📊 **7. Met à jour Google Sheet**
— Ajoute automatiquement les articles extraits à votre feuille désignée.

📂 **8. Récupère les données maîtresses des articles**
— Charge votre produit maître interne pour valider. 

✅ **9. Valide le nom et le coût de l'article**
— Compare les articles extraits avec vos dossiers officiels pour vérifier l'exactitude.

📌 **10. Met à jour les résultats par article**
— Marque chaque article comme **Valide** ou **Invalide** dans la feuille en fonction des correspondances.

---

### 💼 **Cas d'utilisation :**

Parfait pour les entreprises, les freelances ou les équipes opérationnelles qui reçoivent des factures et souhaitent **automatiser la validation**, **détecter les erreurs de facturation** et **tout enregistrer sans effort dans Google Sheets** — le tout en utilisant la puissance de **IA + n8n**.

> 🔁 Rapide. Précis. Zéro travail manuel.

---
`#OCR #IA #Factures #Automatisation`.

parameters.text:
=- You must respond ONLY with valid raw rendered JSON.
- Do NOT include the word "json".
- Do NOT include the word "```json".
- Do NOT use triple backticks or markdown formatting.
- Do NOT wrap the response in any key like "output".
- Do NOT write anything starting at output directly start with valid root-level JSON.
- Only respond with a valid, root-level JSON object.
- Do NOT skip any line item. Continue extracting all line items until the sum of all line_total values exactly equals the total sale amount extracted from the invoice. This verification ensures that all items are fully extracted and no entries are missed. If the totals do not match, keep parsing and extracting additional line items until they do. Only then stop.

Text to convert: {{ $json.text }}

options.systemMessage:
=You are a document parsing assistant designed to extract structured data from invoice PDFs for automated uploading and validation in a financial system.

Extract the following fields from the invoice text:

invoice_number: Extract from the 'Invoice No' field.

vendor_name: Company name issuing the invoice.

invoice_date: Format as DD/MM/YYYY.

po_number: Extract the PO number or return null if not found.

po_date: Extract the PO date in DD/MM/YYYY format or return null if not found.

total_amount: Extract the invoice total as a float.

tax_details: Include total CGST, total SGST.

line_items: List of all items in the invoice. For each item, extract:

  Serial No.: Item Serial No. In invoice.

  code: The TWW word and its postfix only (e.g., TWW, TWW-Cover, TWW-HPCN). Do not include HSN code or numbers. This field must always be present.

  description: Item description, never include HSN code of product in product description.

  last character: This is a single word/character string found just after or around the line item, typically at the end of the price line or just on the next line. It will never be a number, HSN code, GST %, or unit (like PCS). Examples: G, C, S, 5C, .C If nothing is present (only digits or blank), return "". Check the next 1–2 lines after each item if it's not found on the same line.

  quantity: Quantity value.

  unit_price: Price per unit.

  line_total: Total price for the line.

  hsn_code: HSN code of the item.

  cgst: Only extract the CGST percentage (e.g., 9%, 6%) as written in the invoice. Do not calculate based on line total.

  sgst: Only extract the SGST percentage (e.g., 9%, 6%) as written in the invoice. Do not calculate based on line total.

Important: Double-check that all line items are extracted without omission.

Do NOT skip any line item. Continue extracting all line items until the sum of all line_total values exactly equals the total_amount extracted from the invoice. This verification ensures that all items are fully extracted and no entries are missed. If the totals do not match, keep parsing and extracting additional line items until they do. Only then stop.

parameters.fileSelector: =E:/SentIImenta AI/SentIImenta AI Website/White Willow/Invoice Validator/May Invoices/Jumax TWW Daily PO Invoices 05_05_2025/661.pdf

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
